DescriptionÂ¶

Create, modify and access attributes in Maya.

CreationÂ¶

Attributes act like templates in defining certain default values for plugs including the data type, name and initial value. Attributes are generally declared as static OpenMaya.MObject wrappers inside the class definition of a node but can also be created dynamically.

  • A static attribute can act as the template for a plug on multiple dependency nodes.
  • A dynamic attribute can act as the template for a plug on a single dependency node.

By default, attributes are:

  • Readable.
  • Writable.
  • Connectable.
  • Storable.
  • Cached.
  • Not arrays.
  • Have indices that matter.
  • Do not use an array builder.
  • Not keyable.
  • Not hidden.
  • Not used as colors.
  • Not indeterminant.
  • Set to disconnect behavior kNothing.

TypesÂ¶

Each attribute type has a corresponding Function Set that subclasses OpenMaya.MFnAttribute. Each attribute type is capable of accepting certain data types. Complex data types can be manipulated through a subclass of OpenMaya.MFnData.

ModifyingÂ¶

The properties of an attribute can be modified via the OpenMaya.MFnAttribute Function Set. If an attribute was statically defined, modifying its properties can affect a plug on multiple nodes. If an attribute was dynamically defined, modifying its properties can affect a plug on a single node. Plug specific modifications can be made through an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation.

Note

  1. Compound attributes do not create a unique namespace for child attributes. Any child attribute of a compound must have a unique name from all other attributes on a given node.

Note

  1. Attributes which are descendant to a compound array will produce placeholder indices for ancestral elements when used to instantiate an OpenMaya.MPlug.

Note

  1. It is possible to set both OpenMaya.MFnAttribute.keyable and OpenMaya.MFnAttribute.channelBox properties True for an attribute. However once instantiated as a plug this causes an invalid state in which OpenMaya.MPlug.isKeyable and OpenMaya.MPlug.isChannelBox are both True. When setting these properties manually, Maya tries to prevent this from occuring as it produces a visual bug whereby any associated UI control appears non-keyable.

Note

  1. An attribute can be renamed via OpenMaya.MDGModifier.renameAttribute() even if the corresponding dependency node plug is locked. This behaviour is inconsistent with Maya commands.

Warning

  1. An error is not produced when trying to delete an attribute that corresponds to a locked array plug. Subsequently Maya will crash if that locked array plug is connected or has at least one connected element plug.

Warning

  1. An attribute can be renamed via OpenMaya.MDGModifier.renameAttribute() even if the new short or long name already exists on the node. This will result in undefined behaviour.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.addToCompound(compoundAttribute, attribute)Â¶

Add a dynamic attribute to a dynamic compound attribute.

Note

Dynamic attributes should be married to a single dependency node. Callers are responsible for ensuring attribute and compoundAttribute have not already been added to a dependency node. Failing to do so may produce undefined behaviour.

Warning

This operation is not undoable.

Parameters:
  • compoundAttribute (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of a dynamic compound attribute.
  • attribute (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of a dynamic attribute.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If compoundAttribute does not reference a compound attribute.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attr does not reference an attribute.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If compoundAttribute already has a child attribute with the same short name or long name as attribute.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.addToNode(node, attribute)Â¶

Add a dynamic attribute to a dependency node.

Note

Dynamic attributes should be married to a single dependency node. Callers are responsible for ensuring attribute has not already been added to a dependency node. Failing to do so may produce undefined behaviour.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of an unlocked dependency node.
  • attribute (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of a dynamic attribute. The short and long names must not clash with an existing attribute on node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute does not reference an attribute.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If node already has an attribute with the same short name or long name as attribute.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If node is locked.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.createCompoundAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a dynamic compound attribute, useful for storing a related set of data.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) â€“ Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) â€“ Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:

ValueError â€“ If both shortName and longName are None.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrapper of the attribute object.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.createEnumAttribute(fields, shortName=None, longName=None, default=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a dynamic enum attribute based on a mapping of field names to integer values.

Parameters:
  • fields (dict [ basestring, int ]) â€“ Mapping of field names to unique values.
  • shortName (basestring, optional) â€“ Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) â€“ Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • default (basestring, optional) â€“ Default field, must correspond to a key in the fields mapping. If None, the field with the smallest value will be used. Defaults to None.
  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:
  • ValueError â€“ If both shortName and longName are None.
  • ValueError â€“ If the fields mapping is empty or the set of values contained within the fields mapping is not unique.
  • KeyError â€“ If the default field does not exist within the fields mapping.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrapper of the attribute object.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.createMatrixAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=1, matrix=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a dynamic matrix attribute based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnMatrixAttribute.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) â€“ Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) â€“ Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) â€“ Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnMatrixAttribute representing the default data type. Either single precision (kFloat) or double precision (kDouble). Defaults to kDouble.
  • matrix (OpenMaya.MMatrix | OpenMaya.MFloatMatrix, optional) â€“ Default value for the attribute. If None, an identity matrix of the given dataType will be used. Defaults to None.
  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:

ValueError â€“ If both shortName and longName are None.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrapper of the attribute object.

msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.createNumericAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=11, point=False, color=False, value=None, min_=None, max_=None, softMin=None, softMax=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a dynamic numeric attribute based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) â€“ Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) â€“ Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) â€“ Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnNumericData representing the default data type. Valid values are kFloat, kAddr, kChar, kByte, kShort, kInt, kInt64, kDouble, kBoolean, k2Short, k2Int, k2Float, k2Double, k3Short, k3Int, k3Float, k3Double, k4Double. Multi data point types such as k2Float will create a compound attribute of type OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Float. In this case, child attribute names would be suffixed with an index and would be of type OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, storing kFloat data. Defaults to kFloat.
  • point (bool, optional) â€“ If True, the dataType will be ignored and an attribute of type OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float will be created, storing k3Float data. If value is given, it must be a three-element tuple. Child attribute names will be suffixed with 'X', 'Y', 'Z' respectively and will be of type OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, storing kFloat data. Defaults to False.
  • color (bool, optional) â€“ If True and point is False, the dataType will be ignored and an attribute of type OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float will be created, storing k3Float data. If value is given, it must be a three-element tuple. Child attribute names will be suffixed with 'R', 'G', 'B' respectively and will be of type OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, storing kFloat data. Defaults to False.
  • value (numeric-type, optional) â€“ Default value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • min_ (float | int, optional) â€“ Min value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • max_ (float | int, optional) â€“ Max value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • softMin (float | int, optional) â€“ Soft min value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • softMax (float | int, optional) â€“ Soft max value for the attribute. Defaults to None.
  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:
  • ValueError â€“ If both shortName and longName are None.
  • ValueError â€“ If a compound attribute type is passed a value with an incompatible number of elements.
  • TypeError â€“ If the value type is incompatible with the dataType.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrapper of the attribute object.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.createTypedAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=4, value=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a dynamic typed attribute based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnData.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) â€“ Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) â€“ Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) â€“ Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnData representing the default data type. Supported constants are: kComponentList, kDoubleArray, kIntArray, kMatrix, kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface, kPlugin, kPointArray, kString, kStringArray, kVectorArray. Defaults to kString.
  • value (any, optional) â€“

    Default value for the attribute. The following values are compatible with each dataType constant:

    • kComponentList: An OpenMaya.MObject referencing derived OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type data.
    • kMatrix: An OpenMaya.MMatrix or OpenMaya.MTransformationMatrix.
    • kDoubleArray, kIntArray: An iterable of numeric data.
    • kVectorArray: An iterable of OpenMaya.MVector data.
    • kPointArray: An iterable of OpenMaya.MPoint data.
    • kStringArray: An iterable of basestring or json serializable data.
    • kString: A basestring or json serializable data.
    • kPlugin: An OpenMaya.MTypeId specifying a user defined data type.
    • kMesh, kNurbsCurve, kNurbsSurface: None.

    Defaults to None.

  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:
  • ValueError â€“ If both shortName and longName are None.
  • ValueError â€“ If the dataType is unsupported (eg. kNumeric, kFloatArray, etc).
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If the dataType is kComponentList and the OpenMaya.MObject value does not reference component data.
  • TypeError â€“ If the value type is incompatible with the dataType.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrapper of the attribute object.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.createUnitAttribute(shortName=None, longName=None, dataType=2, value=None, min_=None, max_=None, softMin=None, softMax=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a dynamic unit attribute based on a data type constant from OpenMaya.MFnUnitAttribute.

Parameters:
  • shortName (basestring, optional) â€“ Short name for the attribute. longName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • longName (basestring, optional) â€“ Long name for the attribute. shortName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • dataType (int, optional) â€“ Type constant present on OpenMaya.MFnUnitAttribute representing the default data type. Valid values are kAngle, kDistance, kTime. Defaults to kDistance.
  • value (float | int | OpenMaya.MAngle | OpenMaya.MDistance | OpenMaya.MTime, optional) â€“ Default value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • min_ (float | int | OpenMaya.MAngle | OpenMaya.MDistance | OpenMaya.MTime, optional) â€“ Min value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • max_ (float | int | OpenMaya.MAngle | OpenMaya.MDistance | OpenMaya.MTime, optional) â€“ Max value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • softMin (float | int | OpenMaya.MAngle | OpenMaya.MDistance | OpenMaya.MTime, optional) â€“ Soft min value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • softMax (float | int | OpenMaya.MAngle | OpenMaya.MDistance | OpenMaya.MTime, optional) â€“ Soft max value for the attribute, must be compatible with the dataType constant. Defaults to None.
  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:
  • ValueError â€“ If both shortName and longName are None.
  • TypeError â€“ If the value, min, max, softMin or softMax type is incompatible with the dataType.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrapper of the attribute object.

OpenMaya.MObject â€“ Wrappers of the child attributes.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.removeFromNode(node, attribute)Â¶

Remove a dynamic, non-child attribute from a dependency node.

Note

This function safely handles the issue described by warning-1.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of an unlocked dependency node.
  • attribute (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of a dynamic, non-child attribute that exists on node. Must correspond to an unlocked plug which has no locked and connected descendant plugs.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError â€“ If attribute does not exist on node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute does not reference an attribute.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute references a static attribute.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute references a child attribute.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If node is locked.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If the plug corresponding to attribute is locked or has a locked and connected descendant plug.

msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.renameOnNode(node, attribute, newShortName=None, newLongName=None)Â¶

Rename a dynamic attribute on a dependency node.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of an unlocked dependency node.
  • attribute (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of a dynamic attribute that exists on node and corresponds to an unlocked plug.
  • newShortName (basestring) â€“ New short name for attribute. Must not clash with an existing attribute on node. newLongName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • newLongName (basestring) â€“ New long name for attribute. Must not clash with an existing attribute on node. newShortName used if None. Defaults to None.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute does not reference an attribute.
  • ValueError â€“ If both newShortName and newLongName are None.
  • ValueError â€“ If either of the newShortName or newLongName already exists on node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError â€“ If attribute does not exist on node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute references a static attribute.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If the plug corresponding to attribute is locked.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If node is locked.

Rename a dynamic attribute on a dependency node.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of an unlocked dependency node.
  • attributeName (basestring) â€“ Name of a dynamic attribute that exists on node and corresponds to an unlocked plug.
  • newShortName (basestring) â€“ New short name for the attribute corresponding to attributeName. Must not clash with an existing attribute on node. newLongName used if None. Defaults to None.
  • newLongName (basestring) â€“ New long name for the attribute corresponding to attributeName. Must not clash with an existing attribute on node. newShortName used if None. Defaults to None.

  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If node does not reference a dependency node.

  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attributeName references a static attribute.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If the plug corresponding to attributeName is locked.
  • RuntimeError â€“ If node is locked.
msTools.core.maya.attribute_utils.setProperties(attribute, **kwargs)Â¶

Set properties corresponding to any writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute for any attribute. Changes are placed on the undo queue.

Note

See modifying attributes as well as note-3.

Parameters:
  • attribute (OpenMaya.MObject) â€“ Wrapper of an attribute object.
  • **kwargs â€“ Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. See default values above.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError â€“ If attribute does not reference an attribute.

Examples

# Set `attribute` keyable and unreadable
setProperties(attribute, keyable=True, readable=False)

Attempts to return valid attribute names from the data given.

Returns:(str, str) â€“ A two-element tuple.
  1. Short name of an attribute.
